description: Blocks of increasing length using 1,2,3,...,9,10; omit leading 0's.
comments: It appears that the first digit repeats 1, 2, 4, 7, 1, 5, 1, 7, 4, 2, 1. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 05 2011
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
mathematica: nn = 20; d = Flatten[Table[{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 1, 0}, {Ceiling[nn (nn + 1)/22]}]]; Table[e = (n + 1) n/2; s = e - n + 1; FromDigits[d[[s ;; e]]], {n, nn}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 05 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) N=[]; k=Mod(-1,10); for(n=1, 20, while(#N<n, N=concat(N, Vec(Str(1+lift(k++))))); print1(eval(concat(vecextract(N, 2^n-1)))", "); N=vecextract(N, Str("^.."n))) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, May 08 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
